byline.contributor: Mitch Smith reported from Cleveland, and Matt Apuzzo from Washington.
byline.original: By MITCH SMITH and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Cleveland reaches settlement with Justice Dept over what federal authorities say is pattern of unconstitutional policing and excessive use of force; settlement follows judge's acquittal of Officer Michael Brelo on manslaughter charge for his role in 2012 fatal shooting of two unarmed blacks.
lead_paragraph: Federal authorities had cited a pattern of unconstitutional policing and excessive use of force in a report on the Cleveland Division of Police.

headline.main: Cleveland Reaches Settlement With Justice Department Over Police Conduct
headline.print_headline: U.S. Makes Deal With Cleveland on Police Abuses

snippet: Federal authorities had cited a pattern of unconstitutional policing and excessive use of force in a report on the Cleveland Division of Police.
